alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Greene; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 8:21AM EST until February 25 at 9:19AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... White River, Eagle Creek, and Eel River. .Melted snowpack combined with rainfall amounts of one to over two inches from Wednesday evening through today falling on frozen ground has caused significant runoff which will produce flooding along area rivers. Along the main stem rivers, flooding could be lengthened and possibly worsened by another storm system next week. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 25... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Newberry. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Friday, February 25. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Extensive agricultural flooding is in progress. Some state and county roads flood. County Road 600 W just north of river flooded by possibly more than two feet of water for a considerable distance in Mary Long Cutoff Area. County Roads 900 W and 750 S begin to flood in Greene County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to 18.7 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued later today.
